skillTree.localised_description: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Tzeentch has:
	➕  Barrier
	➕  Magical Attacks

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

skillTree.localised_description: Like other Luminarks, Volker’s personal mount is a locus for Hysh’s divine power, which can be harnessed to fire deadly blasts at foes. However, certain Tzeentchian modifications have bolstered its already impressive magical abilities. The Luminark is also complemented by a crew of gunners, cultists and an Iridescent Horror, making this vehicle an even deadlier foe to face.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Our eyes embedded in the cities and courts of the enemies foil their plans and feed them misinformation.

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: +20% for all enemy spellcasters
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Influx of new recruits demands larger living arrangements.
Volker’s harsh training and strict rules permit only the most cunning to succeed within the Cult.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Mortals followers of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Mortals followers of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who show proper reverence to the Changer will receive the carrot, those who do not… will regret it.
With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: Matthias Volker was once a devoted student of Hysh. His descent into madness began after being denied the position of Supreme Patriarch by the Wizard Conclave.

skillTree.localised_description: “Plunder their libraries, colleges and holy places! Find every last tome and arcane artefact!”

skillTree.localised_description: Covert agents have been placed in key roles within the enemy’s society, ensuring that all of their myopic ploys are foiled before they come to fruition.

effects.description: This character becomes able to see enemies hiding in forest regardless of distance

skillTree.localised_description: After being passed over as a candidate for the leader of Altdorf’s Conclave, Volker furiously stormed out of the Colleges, swearing vengeance. Gideon would exploit his grudge to make him a loyal servant of Sheerargetru.

skillTree.localised_description: “The more sheep we send to the Great Schemer, the more boons he will bestow upon us!”

skillTree.localised_description: Matthias oversees the Broken Wheel from his headquarters in the underbelly of Altdorf, plotting and scheming until his master is ready to execute his devious plan.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75

skillTree.localised_description: To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

items.colour_text: An embellished blue hood, designed to hide Volker’s identity from the public eye. Only his most trusted acolytes have seen the High Magister’s true, twisted face.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
